description: From Spanish cordel (“surveying rope, 50 varas”), from Catalan cordell (“cord, string”), from Vulgar Latin *cordellus (“little rope”), from Latin chorda (“rope, cord”) + -ellus (“-elle: forming diminutives”). Equivalent to cord +‎ -el.

entries.meaning: (historical) Spanish chain, a traditional Spanish and Mexican unit of distance equivalent to about 41.9 m.
